alert.note: Alert for Imperial County West; Imperial Valley; Salton Sea (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued May 03 at 11:55AM PDT until May 04 at 3:00AM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 3 AM PDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...West winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. * WHERE...Salton Sea, Western Imperial County and Imperial Valley. * WHEN...From 5 PM this afternoon to 3 AM PDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Difficult driving conditions, especially for larger vehicles traveling along roads with crosswinds. Light, unsecured objects may become airborne. Minor tree damage possible.
info.instruction: A Wind Advisory means that sustained wind speeds of between 30 and 40 mph are expected, or wind gusts of between 40 and 58 mph. Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. In addition, strong winds over desert areas could result in briefly lowered visibilities to well under a mile at times in blowing dust or blowing sand. Use extra caution.

area.areaDesc: Imperial County West; Imperial Valley; Salton Sea
